Description: Cylindrical pottery vase of marl clay, with everted roll over rim and a vestigial wavy handle in the form of a band of scallops pushed into the clay. The body is painted with red diagonal lines in wide cross-hatched or ‘net’ pattern.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), pl. xxxiii. 62a A.J. Spencer, Pottery in Predynastic Egypt, in I. Freestone and D. Gaimster, Pottery in the Making: World ceramic traditions. British Museum Press, London (1997), p. 48 right Most like Proto 46f6 in Petrie’s Corpus of Protodynastic pottery (1953).
